contentPreview:
=== story.txt ===
I remember the moment that sparked this project. It was during a walk across Middlebury’s campus late one fall afternoon—just after office hours. A student had come in, clearly bright but struggling, and told me they’d been using ChatGPT late at night to help with assignments because they were too anxious to speak up in class. That confession stuck with me.

Later, over coffee with Germán, we started wondering—how many students were turning to generative AI as a quiet lifelin...

podcastFormats.title: AI Unplugged: The Silent Shift in Higher Education
podcastFormats.description: An in-depth exploration of how generative AI is reshaping the learning landscape in elite colleges, focusing on student experiences and institutional responses.
segments: The Spark: Anecdotes from Students
Data Breakdown: Understanding AI Adoption Rates
Disparities in Usage: Who's Using AI and Why?
Institutional Policies: Navigating the New Norm
Future Implications: What Lies Ahead for Education?
key_questions: What drove students to adopt AI for academic assistance?
How does AI usage differ across various demographics and disciplines?
What policies have institutions implemented in response to AI adoption, and how effective are they?
potential_guests: Zara Contractor - Co-author of the study
Germán Reyes - Co-author of the study
An academic policy expert
A current student using AI in their studies
unique_elements: On-the-ground student interviews showcasing personal stories
Incorporation of survey data visualizations to illustrate key findings
Expert commentary highlighting implications for educational equity and policy

podcastFormats.title: AI in Academia: Hypotheses vs. Real Experiences
podcastFormats.description: A Socratic dialogue format examining the assumptions surrounding AI use in education against the research findings and student experiences.
segments: Introduction: Setting the Scene
Hypothesis 1: AI is a tool for cheating vs. Reality: Strategic Learning Aid
Hypothesis 2: AI usage is uniform across demographics vs. Reality: Adoption Disparities
Hypothesis 3: Institutional policies will curb misuse vs. Reality: Mixed Outcomes
Conclusion: Bridging the Gap between Hypothesis and Reality
key_questions: What are the common misconceptions about AI in education?
How do real student experiences challenge or support these hypotheses?
What evidence exists to inform better institutional policies?
potential_guests: Educational psychologist specializing in technology
Student representatives from diverse fields of study
Policy maker involved in education reform
AI ethics researcher
unique_elements: Incorporation of live polls to gauge audience beliefs
Interactive segments allowing listeners to submit questions
Dramatic readings of student testimonials to illustrate points

podcastFormats.title: Generative AI and the Quest for Learning: A Scientist's Journey
podcastFormats.description: A biographical exploration of the researchers behind the study, detailing their motivations, findings, and the implications of their work on future education.
segments: The Origin Story: What Inspired the Research
The Research Journey: Challenges and Discoveries
Key Findings: Insights into Student Behavior
Reflections on the Future of Learning
Call to Action: What Can Be Done?
key_questions: What personal experiences shaped the researchers' perspectives on AI in education?
What were the most surprising findings from the research?
How do the researchers envision the future of AI in educational contexts?
potential_guests: Zara Contractor - Co-author of the study
Germán Reyes - Co-author of the study
An educational technology historian
A student who has used AI extensively
unique_elements: Narrative storytelling style interwoven with personal anecdotes
Soundscapes from campus life to create an immersive experience
Reflections on broader societal implications of AI adoption in education

contentPreview:
=== Kurt paper.txt ===
Photo Steward: A Deliberative Collective Intelligence Workflow for Validating Historical Archives
Vikram Mohanty, Computer Science, Virginia Tech, USA, vikrammohanty@vt.edu
Kurt Luther, Computer Science, Virginia Tech, USA, kluther@vt.edu

DOI: https://doi.org/10.1145/3582269.3615600
CI '23: Collective Intelligence Conference, Delft, Netherlands, November 2023
Historical photographs of people generate significant cultural and economic value, but correctly identifying...

podcastFormats.title: Unmasking the Past: The Quest for Historical Photo Accuracy
podcastFormats.description: An investigative exploration into the challenges of identifying historical photographs and how technology can aid in preserving accurate narratives.
segments: The Importance of Accurate Historical Identification
Challenges in Historical Photo Identification
Inside the Photo Steward Workflow
key_questions: Why is accurate identification of historical photos crucial for our culture?
What are the major challenges faced in identifying individuals in historical photographs?
How does the Photo Steward system improve the validation of historical photo IDs?
potential_guests: Vikram Mohanty (Co-author of the study)
Kurt Luther (Co-author of the study)
Expert in digital archiving or historical photography
unique_elements: In-depth case studies of misidentified photos
Live demonstrations of the Photo Steward interface
Listener Q&A on historical photo identification

Reality Check: The Limitations of Facial Recognition

How does community input shape the accuracy of historical narratives?

Historical archivist

unique_elements: Role-playing as advocates for each hypothesis
